title: Drawing, "Fountain"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d) and Mrs. Mary Brandegee (Lugt#1860c)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Shown like 1938-88-1774. The design is a variation of that of 1938-88-1774. Urns containing fires stand upon the enclosure. Upon the ledges stand genii, blowing trumpets, upon trophies of arms, Neptune stands before the pavilion. No inscription is shown but a statue is written in the pavillion. Dark brown framing band. Framed by gray-blue paper stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Fountain".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1775.
